custom_fields.goals: 1Demonstrate a sound understanding of the design and rational behind western blot technique, identify the different steps of the experimental protocol, distinguish between the type of controls and understand their relevance2Apply western blot technique to study insulin signaling in mammalian cells, generate and analyze scientific data3Prepare, present and discuss a summary of their experimentation and conclusions with their peers
custom_fields.key_topics: The course provides a hands-on experience in biology lab to conduct experiments, collect and analyze scientific data with the purpose of using the data to infer biological principals. Students will learn the details of western blot technique, commonly used in biology labs. In addition, they will apply the technique to study how insulin triggers specific signaling in target cells.
custom_fields.prerequisite_knowledge: This course has 03-240 Cell Biology as a co-requisite course
custom_fields.assessment_structure: In this course, students will have 2 quizzes, a final presentation, a final exam and an assignment on data analysis
custom_fields.relevance: This lab module will reinforce the students' understanding of material seen in Cell Biology lecture course (co-requisite 03-240) and will prepare them for future lab courses.
custom_fields.learning_resources: All learning resources will be provided by the course instructor
custom_fields.extra_time_commitment: Outside the lab sessions, students are required to review material before coming to the lab and work on data analysis and preparing/submitting assignments
